item.title: [PI] Welcome Screen / Login Interface
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:23, topic:549618”][quote author=malimt link=topic=668512.msg4489436#msg4489436 date=1436580231]
So you think it’s not possible to fix this up and fully add it/port it into 317/474?
I could really use this interface, i’ve always liked it!
[/quote]
Anything is possible with programming.
It just depends on your level of skill.

Can we see a picture of what your screen looks like?
Also, this might be of use.

rune-server.ee

Rune-Server

Rune-Server


Sorry, I took a while.
I was bit busy, but here I added it again and here’s a picture of what it looks like: http://prntscr.com/7se6tt
Here’s the code I added:

getPA().showInterface(15244); getPA().sendFrame126("@bla@Welcome to AppleRS!", 15257); getPA().sendFrame126("Owner: Malimt - Last Connected From: "+ connectedFrom, 15258); getPA().sendFrame126("New Server! \\nStart Playing Now!.\\nNew Updates Will Be Out Soon!", 15259); getPA().sendFrame126("Useful Commands\\n \\nRules - ::rules\\nCommands List - ::commands\\nStaff Online - ::staff", 15260); getPA().sendFrame126("", 15261); if(playerRights == 4) { getPA().sendFrame126("You're Currently A Member! \\nEnjoy The Server With All Features!\\n\\nYour Membership NEVER Expires!", 15262); } else { getPA().sendFrame126("You're Currently Not A Member! \\nWe Suggest You Become One Since It\\nHas Huge Benefits!\\nIt's Only 5.00 Euro's!", 15262); } getPA().sendFrame126("Play AppleRS", 15263); getPA().sendFrame126("At 7 Donators The Server Will Be 24/7!\\nYou Can Also Donate For Rares!", 15270);
IS there a way to kind of change the size? Or possibly the interface?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

I hope you’re adding the player to game after they press “Play” because loading that interface and adding player to world could lead to all sorts of problems!

You don’t want a player logging into the wilderness and have that interface open!

item.title: [PI] Welcome Screen / Login Interface
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“malimt, post:17, topic:549618”][quote author=Damoiscool link=topic=668512.msg4483008#msg4483008 date=1431552740]

How do I make the play button clickable? I can’t click it to exit the interface.

That’s because it’s not a finished tutorial. Find out the clickingbuttons id in your server console and add it to clicking buttons.Java in the switch statement and something like this is if your using PI. Idk haven’t worked with PI in a while.

[/quote]
How would that be done exactly? I’m looking forward to fixing it, just can’t seem to find out how…[/quote]
Pretty sure the button sends packet 185 (ClickingButtons). So get the button ID and then use either removeAllWindows() or closeAllWindows() (Both packets are almost identical) method in the PlayerAssistant.
Alternatively, you can edit the button client sided and when it’s clicked you can remove the interfaces… You’d have to add a trace statement (System.out.println) to trace the ID of the button, then find where the buttons are handled in the client, and remove the windows there.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Welcome Screen / Login Interface
item.dc:creator: @seankroes seankroes
item.description:
@seankroes wrote:

whattehp406:

The “You’re membership never expires” has to be “Your” though. You use “You’re” as in “You are” and “Your” as in what belongs or applies to you, like “Your membership” or “You’re a member”.

Thank you for correcting my mistakes

Read full topic
